news.title: NCLAT sets aside plea against Nuvoco Vistas acquisition of Vadraj Cement
news.para: The NCLAT has upheld the acquisition of Vadraj Cement by Nuvoco Vistas, dismissing a plea challenging the resolution plan. The tribunal affirmed the NCLT's approval of Nuvoco's bid, which includes an upfront payment of Rs 1,800 crore.

news.title: Thane civic body forms special squad to curb unauthorised constructions
news.para: The Thane Municipal Corporation has established a special squad to combat the rising number of illegal constructions in Diva and Mumbra, following numerous complaints. Commissioner Saurabh Rao ordered the team's formation after a review meeting, highlighting the urgency to address these violations.

news.title: UP to launch QR code-based property checks, instant registries, ease rent agreements: Minister
news.para: Uttar Pradesh is set to revolutionize property transactions with QR codes for ownership verification and instant title updates by 2026. The state aims to simplify rent agreements with reduced stamp duty and streamline family property settlements. These reforms, part of Vision 2047, seek to enhance transparency, reduce litigation, and boost investor confidence, driving increased property registrations.

news.title: Ensure no illegalities in sand quarrying: Madras HC to authorities
news.para: Madras High Court addressed a petition regarding illegal sand quarrying. The court instructed authorities to adhere to established guidelines. Allegations of irregularities in river sand operations were presented. The state denied these claims, affirming adherence to government guidelines. The court cannot investigate the allegations. Petitioners can submit complaints with evidence. Authorities must investigate and act accordingly.

news.title: Pay property tax within 10 days or face action, Ranchi civic body tells defaulters
news.para: The Ranchi Municipal Corporation has published a list of the top 500 property tax defaulters on its website, urging them to clear dues within 10 days. The RMC warned that failure to comply will result in strict legal action under the Jharkhand Municipal Act, 2011.

news.title: Sammaan Capital raises $300 million via overseas bond issue
news.para: Sammaan Capital (formerly Indiabulls Housing) has successfully raised $300 million through a three-year bond issuance to overseas investors at 8.95%. This marks their first international issuance under the new brand and aims to diversify their funding base, targeting 10% from international sources. The company plans further overseas borrowing to reach 10-15% within the next year.

news.title: Bombay HC directs strict adherence to safety recommendations in building norms for high rise construction
news.para: Bombay High Court mandates strict adherence to safety protocols for high-rise construction, incorporating expert committee recommendations into development permissions. Directives issued to municipal bodies require vigilant oversight, with violations leading to stop-work notices and potential criminal action. The ruling follows a 2023 petition prompted by a fatal construction accident in Worli, emphasizing human safety.

news.title: Kolkata civic body to monitor health of new buildings for 10 years
news.para: The Kolkata Municipal Corporation will monitor reconstructed houses on Durga Pituri Lane for a decade, ensuring KMRC compensates for any metro-related damage. Concerns arose at a KMC meeting about building safety after metro operations began. The KMC approved KMRC's building plans, and a Jadavpur University committee will provide technical expertise.

news.title: After seven years & four attempts, Ghaziabad’s master plan gets government approval
news.para: Uttar Pradesh government sanctions Master Plan 2031. The plan focuses on Ghaziabad, Modinagar and Loni. It introduces Transit-Oriented Development and Special Development Area zones. The plan aims to meet future demands for housing and industry. Land allocation changes include increased residential and commercial space. Green spaces are also earmarked.

news.title: Mysuru development body's online auction of stray sites in upscale layouts witness high bids
news.para: Mysuru Development Authority's online auction of stray sites in upscale layouts has witnessed unexpectedly high bids, with some properties fetching two to three times their base price. A 745sqft corner plot in Vijayanagar IV stage received a bid of Rs 2 crore, while a 4,133sqft site garnered Rs 9 crore.

news.title: Appointment of Himachal Pradesh RERA chief challenged
news.para: The Himachal Pradesh High Court addressed a petition challenging R.D. Dhiman's appointment as RERA chairman, issuing a notice to the state government. Rajeev Verma, a former RERA member, filed the petition, alleging the government overlooked the selection committee's preference order. The court clarified that Dhiman's selection is subject to the petition's outcome, with the next hearing scheduled for September 15.

news.title: Ghaziabad development body to hear out buyers’ complaints once a month
news.para: The Ghaziabad Development Authority has initiated 'Rera Samadhan Diwas' to resolve grievances against it within UP Rera. Held monthly, this initiative aims to address homebuyer complaints directly, preempting the need for regulatory intervention. During the inaugural session, a few complaints were resolved, and assurances led to some complainants withdrawing their cases from UP Rera.

news.title: Nagpur SROs didn’t report real estate deals worth over ₹5,500 crore to I-T department
news.para: The Income Tax Department's investigation into unreported real estate transactions in Nagpur has uncovered over Rs 5,500 crore in deals not reported under the Statement of Financial Transactions (SFT). The probe, initiated by the IC wing, began at Hingna SRO and expanded to other city SROs.

news.title: SC upholds Bombay HC order quashing SRA acquisition of Bandra Church land
news.para: The Supreme Court has upheld a Bombay High Court order, quashing the acquisition of Church Trust land in Bandra by the Slum Redevelopment Authority (SRA). The court criticized the SRA for favoring a private developer, Saldanha Real Estate, over the landowner's redevelopment proposal.

news.title: Gujarat CM approves ₹490 crore grant for construction of panchayat houses
news.para: To ensure that Gram Panchayats, the fundamental and significant unit of the three-tier Panchayati Raj system, have their own Panchayat buildings, CM Patel has sanctioned a substantial grant for this purpose, the Chief Minister's office said in a press release.

news.title: NIT report in HC suggests retrofitting for LIFE Mission buildings
news.para: NIT Kozhikode's report suggests that the incomplete LIFE Mission housing project in Wadakkancherry can be salvaged with structural interventions, despite poor workmanship and abandonment. Submitted to the Kerala HC, the report addresses a petition seeking project resumption for 140 beneficiary families.

news.title: Greater Bengaluru authority set for September launch
news.para: The historic BBMP head office, home to the city’s administration since 1947, is being upgraded to function as the Chief Minister’s office in his capacity as Chairperson of the new authority. The Bengaluru Urban Development Minister, serving as Deputy Chairperson, will operate from the renovated Deputy Mayor’s office.

news.title: MHA writes to Chandigarh administration again, seeks response on property-related issues
news.para: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has escalated pressure on the Chandigarh administration, issuing a fresh letter to the UT chief secretary demanding responses to long-pending property-related issues. These issues, raised by MP Manish Tewari, include property sales, housing modifications, 'lal dora' abolition, resettlement colony ownership, and group housing society concerns.

news.title: Mumbai: BMC to introduce professional safety licence for officers for high-rise construction sites
news.para: Following Bombay High Court directions, the BMC is urged to introduce professional safety licenses for high-rise projects due to increasing tower crane incidents. The recommendation includes mandating Licensed Safety Officers (LSO) and safety teams for buildings exceeding 120 meters.

news.title: Bengaluru development body invites global tenders to prepare revised master plan-2041
news.para: Bangalore Development Authority has initiated a global tender for the Revised Master Plan 2041, aiming for a data-driven and inclusive framework. This follows the shelving of RMP 2031 due to criticisms. A high-tech 3D drone survey is underway to provide detailed spatial understanding, integrating transit-oriented development to combat congestion and enhance livability, with completion targeted by mid-2026.
